author: Special Correspondent
text:
Rich tributes were paid to Alathur Brothers by speakers at a function organised to release a book as a mark of tribute to the great musicians in recognition of their contribution to the music.

The function, got up by Sri Sathguru Thigabrahma Aradhna Trust and Sri Sathguru Sangeetha Sabha formed part of the 169th aradhana to Sadguru Thyagaraja Swamigal, here recently.

Noted vidwan Prince Rama Varma, who released the book titled “Alathur Brothers – United in Music”, spoke on the innovation in music introduced by the Alathur Brothers.

He complimented the efforts by author Lakshmi Devnath in compiling and producing important and interesting information about these musicians.

S. Thiagarajan, son of Alathur Subbier and founding managing trustee of the Trust, received the first copy. He said that the late Alathur Brothers – Alathur Venkatesa Iyer and P. Sundaresa Iyer evolved a new dimension to carnatic music.

Mridgangam artiste honoured

The function also marked honouring of mridangam vidwan S. Venkataraman. S. Gopinath, Executive Director of BHEL, honoured him with a citation and purse in recognition of his service. T. Rajaganesh, managing trustee of the trust, spoke about the activities of the trust.
title: Tributes to Alathur Brothers paid
